“Why the fuck is this in my recommendations?”

Lol.....
That is a lot of work! This is how I make litmus paper: Step one, soak plain white paper in red wine for 15 to 30 minutes. Step two, take paper out of wine bath. Step 3, dry the paper and watch as it turns purple. Step 4, cut into strips. Step 5, the dry purple paper, now will indicate base or acid in degrees like litmus paper with the added benefit of showing strength in the solution. How does it show strength/percentage in a solution? It gives a rainbow effect which can tell you how quickly the solution stops effecting the paper. Pretty cool huh?!?! You can even develope your own pictorial color chart to establish your own tests. So, to wrap things up.... a couple table spoons of wine and a single sheet of paper should give you a pretty good supply of litmus paper. Kept dry there is no shelf life, even though the color might change a little as the paper fibers uptake more of the coloring. I hope you try it and pass it on.
